page.title: 11WEST DERBY BUILDINGS,L'POOL
page.content: OUR VILLAGE IS LOVELY.SOME BUILDINGS ARE VERY QUAINT AND OLD.IT IS A VERY BUSY VILLAGE.THERE IS ALWAYS LOTS OF TRAFFIC AND PEOPLE COME HERE TO DO THEIR SHOPPING.CLOSE TO THE WEST DERBY PUB THERE IS A MONUMENT WHERE THE CHURCH ONCE STOOD.NEARBY IS CROXTETH PARK,ONE OF THE NICEST PLACES IN LIVERPOOL.MEADOW LANE IS A NARROW ROAD.DOWN THERE IS THE CHURCH.OUR SCHOOL IS QUITE A MODERN BUILDING,BEING REBUILT TEN YEARS AGO.AT THE TOP OF THE SCHOOL PLAYGROUND IS THE COTTAGE WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1666.ON THE CORNER OF MILL LANE IS A BIG PUB CALLED THE SEFTON ARMS.ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF MILL LANE IS A ROW OF SHOPS WHICH CONTINUES INTO TOWN ROW.THERE ARE TOILETS,BARCLAYS BANK AND WEST DERBY CHAPEL.NEAR THE SCHOOL IS THE BUTCHER'S,T.S.B.BANK AND THE GARAGE.THERE ARE A FEW NEW FLATS.
